group_1.narration: I asked about my family history on the way there.
It seems that long, long ago, @the Hiroe family was formed by people @who left Tokime Village.
And that females in the Hiroe family had been @told to be wary of the Tokime Clan.
Apparently, the phone call had frightened @my mom because the Tokime head family @had gotten a hold of our address, proving @that the legends had been true all along.
The whole thing certainly does feel mysterious.
They say we moved out of the village generations ago, @so I have no idea why we were summoned.
But despite all that, @I felt as if our feet had just naturally carried us @to this little recess in the mountains.

group_1.textCenter: [chara:102601:effect_emotion_joy_0][se:7222_happy]There's plants and insects everywhere, @and the air is so fresh! This feels AWESOME!
Every time I take a breath, my lungs feel that much @cleaner—!

group_1.textLeft: Ahahaha! Glad to hear that you like the place @so much.

group_1.textRight: We're sorry for making you guide us such a long @way...

group_1.textLeft: Aw, it's nothing.
Lady Mikoshiba called you here, @so it's just common courtesy to welcome you.
Plus, it'd be dangerous for you two to walk here @alone.
You must be tired after the long trip.
Please feel free to use this house during your stay.

group_1.textRight: Huh... How many generations old IS this place...?

group_1.textLeft: Yep, that's about what all our new visitors say.
There's no radio reception, @we hardly ever watch TV...
We do bring in new technology from time to time, @but life here is still very rustic on the whole.
Well, go on now! Step inside.
Lady Mikoshiba is waiting to greet you, after all.
The village's head priestess. She's the most @important person here!
And with that, I'll be taking my leave. Do excuse me.
Any time! See you 'round, little lady.

group_1.textRight: If this were a Kouichi Todoroki story...this village @is exactly where an incident would occur...!

group_1.textLeft: Zip it! You're going to jinx us at this rate...
Excuse us.

group_1.textCenter: My apologies for making you come such a long way.

group_1.textRight: Oh, you're the one who called us?

group_1.textLeft: Ye must have heard from the villagers. I am the priestess, Mikoshiba.
Well, ye two must be tired. @Please, sit down and have yourself a seat.
Would you like any snacks, young Chiharu?
Ahh, think nothing of it. I'm the one who summoned you, after all.
How do ye feel?
It's an empty little place, our village, but @it's still got its own charm, no?

group_1.textRight: Yeah! The air is so fresh. I think I'm really going to @like this.

group_1.textLeft: It's because we have coexisted with the Land of the Rising Sun for hundreds and thousands of years,
because we have offered up our souls and preserved our traditions,
that this village remaineth till today.
Indeed, isn't it?
Thus hath the Tokime persevered. Unlike the Hiroes, who left.

group_1.textRight: Um, by that, do you mean...?

group_1.textLeft: Thou know thyself well, mother of Hiroe. @My apologies, but let me say this frankly.
I summoned ye two here...
Well, to be precise, I summoned Chiharu here for @just one reason.

group_1.narration: "I ask that ye offer up your soul, @for the sake of our clan and the Land of the Rising Sun."

group_1.textRight: Offer up...her soul...? What are you going to do with Chiharu...?

group_1.textLeft: Ah, sorry. @Perhaps that was a bad choice of words on my part.
I'm certainly not asking you to die, of course.

group_1.textRight: But, what you said just now...

group_1.textLeft: To "offer up one's soul" is to swear an oath.
That is to say, I want Chiharu to swear an oath to @our god,
and become a Diviner.
A magnificent being that helpeth people— @no, the entire nation.

group_1.textRight: A magnificent being that helps people...

group_1.textLeft: A superhero?

group_1.textRight: A really awesome person who helps everyone!

group_1.textLeft: I suppose so!
Chiharu, calm down.
Offering her soul as a vow to a god, becoming a Diviner...
As her mother, I can't agree to any of this without knowing what it all really entails.
All of which are perfectly understandable concerns, @o mother of Hiroe.
I won't ask ye to decide right away.
Tomorrow, I shall send two Diviners to meet you, @so ye may ask them whatever you like.
